description.narrative: The Power Grid Corporation of India Limited (Power Grid or the Company) is Indias inter-state and inter-regional transmission utility, majority owned by the Government of India (GOI), and plays a critical role in strengthening the countrys transmission infrastructure. Power Grid being the national transmission utility has a capital expenditure plan of US$16 billion during the FY13-17 period (the Project) for further development of national grid. In order to fund the Project, Power Grid needed to raise about US$1 billion of equity. Simultaneously, the GOI divested 4 percent of its existing shareholding to help meet its disinvestment targets for the current fiscal year, reduce its fiscal deficit and help anchor the commercial orientation of a key enterprise. The Company had requested that IFC support the project by participating as an investor in the FPO. Accordingly, IFC made an equity investment of US$20.4 million through its participation in the FPO.

The Project is expected to have the following development impact: A. Support the critical transmission infrastructure of the country which is essential to improve access to electricity and promote inclusive growth. B. Facilitate an increase in the private sector investment in power generation including renewables. C. Promote Climate Change Mitigation by reducing electricity transmission losses thereby eliminating GHG emissions from avoided generation.
